sentence.Network_en: We cannot remain a passive onlooker to the hysteric moves of the enemies.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent. (as an adjective): via Latin from Greek husterikos 'of the womb', from hustera 'womb' (hysteria being thought to be specific to women and associated with the womb)

means.word_mean: 1. characterized by or arising from psychoneurotic hysteria;

sentences.sentence: "during hysterical conditions various functions of the human body are disordered"- Morris Fishbein

sentences.en: My mum’ll have hysterics when she sees the colour of my hair.
